bibdata.title: IEEE Recommended Practice for Specifying Electric Submersible Pump CableEthylene-Propylene Rubber Insulation
Redline
IEEE Recommended Practice for Specifying Electric Submersible Pump CableEthylene-Propylene Rubber Insulation - Redline
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std 1018-2013 (Revison of IEEE Std 1018-2004) - Redline

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: Minimum requirements for the design, construction, manufacturing, testing, purchasing, and application of electric submersible pump (ESP) cable are presented. The cable is round or flat, with ethylenepropylene rubber insulation, nitrile jacket, ethylenepropylene diene monomer (EPDM) jacket or lead sheath, and armor. These cables are for voltages not exceeding 3 kV or 5 kV (phase to phase) and conductor temperatures not exceeding 140 C (284 F) for nitrile or a maximum of 232 C (450 F) for EPDM jacket or lead sheath cable. Conductors, insulation, barrier (optional), assembly with or without jacket, armor, requirements for testing by the manufacturer, and cable ampacity are all covered in the document.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
